poem:
"Gabriel's Caution"

Voters, beware the seductive right—
Gabriel observes from his airy height.
"See Britons, weeping in their tea,
Regretting choices impulsively.
Their proud Union, now in fractures,
Etched in tears, their bitter captions.
In ballot silence, some breathed sighs,
Their absence birthed divisive lies.
Thus Gabriel warns, in honest tone,
Let not regret curdle bone."
